meanings.sent1: The vogue for bright colors is evident in the latest fashion show.
meanings.sent2: Denim jackets are currently in vogue among teenagers.
meanings.sent3: It seems the vogue for oversized hats is making a comeback.
meanings.sent4: The vogue of social media influencers has changed the way we perceive beauty.
meanings.sent5: Her unique sense of style set a new vogue in the fashion industry.

meanings.definition: The prevailing fashion or style at a particular time.
meanings.sent1: In the 1920s, flapper dresses were the vogue among young women.
meanings.sent2: The vogue of long skirts gave way to the trend of mini skirts in the 1960s.
meanings.sent3: His attempt to bring back bell-bottom pants was met with mixed reactions from his friends.
meanings.sent4: The vogue of wearing hats indoors is considered old-fashioned in modern times.
meanings.sent5: The vogue of wearing mismatched socks became a quirky trend among the youth.

meanings.definition: To be in fashion or style.
meanings.sent1: She always tries to vogue with the latest trends to impress her friends.
meanings.sent2: It's important for celebrities to vogue to maintain their public image.
meanings.sent3: He attempted to vogue with a retro look but ended up looking out of place.
meanings.sent4: The young designer managed to vogue her way into the elite fashion circles.
meanings.sent5: Despite her efforts to vogue, she still felt like she didn't fit in with the crowd.
